page.title: 13Pets
page.content: Our survey shows that more families have dogs than cats.Only 16% out of a hundred people had rabbits,mainly because they are cheap to keep.6% had ponies.Not many people have ponies now,as they cost a lot to keep.4% had roosters,8% had guinnea-pigs and another 4% had hamsters.Only one family had tadpoles.This means dogs are more popular than any other animals.Sometimes other stranger animals are kept.One family had a lobster and a snake!Animals are kept mainly for children to love and care for.
